meanings.definition: A strategy designed to oppose or neutralize an opposing strategy.
meanings.sent1: The team developed a counterstrategy to defend against the opponent's strong offense.
meanings.sent2: She quickly devised a counterstrategy to outsmart her rival in the chess match.
meanings.sent3: The counterstrategy of wearing sunglasses indoors to block the bright light was quite effective.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor was his counterstrategy to her aggressive approach.
meanings.sent5: The counterstrategy of using distraction techniques helped the magician perform the trick flawlessly.

meanings.definition: An action taken in response to a strategy to achieve a different outcome.
meanings.sent1: The company implemented a counterstrategy to increase sales after analyzing the market trends.
meanings.sent2: His decision to invest in technology was a smart counterstrategy to adapt to the changing industry.
meanings.sent3: The counterstrategy of taking a different route to avoid traffic actually led to a scenic drive.
meanings.sent4: Her counterstrategy of offering a discount attracted more customers to the store.
meanings.sent5: The counterstrategy of using humor to diffuse tension in the meeting worked wonders.
